page.title: 10Old Gilmerton.
page.content: The oldest houses in this south fringe of {Edinburgh}are found in G .Ref 2968 in the old village of Gilmerton.} Along Ravenscroft st and Drum st the houses are built of sandstone and roofed mainly in Welsh slate. Some are small single-storey cottages roofed in red, clay tiles.There is also two storey terraced housing.In Ravenscroft St there are a few substantial georgian-type villas rather in need of a face-lift.There is little evidence of planning in the lay-out of old{ {Gilmerton.} The parish church and war memorial are in Ravenscroft St.which was formerly the main Street.Drum St and newtoft St are rather narrow for the amount of traffic with which they have to cope.Hopefully the new by-pass will solve this problem when its finshed.
